txt.en: 'Go to Mithrandir atop the slag-hill and see what he thinks of this new arrival, [placeholder]. Quickly!'
Book 9, Chapter 1: Sauron's Hour
'DNT - Blah!'

'The Battle of the Black Gate is nearly done, [placeholder]. We must fight for as long as we can, in memory of our friends and in defence of those endangered by Mordor. This may be Sauron's hour, but we will make him earn it with blood!'
Talk to Mithrandir atop the eastern slag-hill during the Battle of the Morannon

'We must fight for as long as we can, in memory of our friends and in defence of those endangered by Mordor. This may be Sauron's hour, but we will make him earn it with blood!'
Foes encircle the Host of the West as the Battle of the Black Gate rages around you.

'We must fight for as long as we can, in memory of our friends and in defence of those endangered by Mordor. This may be Sauron's hour, but we will make him earn it with blood!\n\n'Defeat the foes you can during the Battle of the Morannon, my friend!'
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
Defeat foes at the Battle of the Morannon ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Elrohir stands on the north-west side of the slag-hill and wishes to speak with you.

Mithrandir stands atop the eastern slag-hill while the Battle of the Morannon rages all about him.\n\nElrohir has seen something on the horizon and has asked you to tell Mithrandir about this new threat.
The Host of the West fights desperately for its survival as the forces of Mordor close in for the kill, and the Battle of the Morannon nears its end.

'I see something on the distant horizon, but I cannot yet make it out. Does a new threat seek to strike from the rear?\n\n'Go to Mithrandir atop the slag-hill and see what he thinks of this new arrival, [placeholder]. Quickly!'

'What now, [placeholder]? You bring tidings from the sons of Elrond? They did not wish to tell me themselves?'\n\nThe Wizard readies a further rebuke for the Elves, but it remains unsaid. His eye lights upon the distant horizon and wonder brightens his face.
